alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 13 at 12:50AM PDT until March 13 at 11:00PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: .2 to 3 inches of rain is expected to fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to increasing snowmelt. Flows in small creeks, streams and rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. Major rivers are not anticipated to flood at this time. ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM PDT EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Areal flooding in small creeks and streams caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...Portions of Curry County and western Josephine County, including the Illinois Valley and Brookings, Gold Beach, Agness, Cave Junction, Selma, and Takilma. * WHEN...From 5 AM PDT early this morning through Tuesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Large quantities of moisture are anticipated to move into the region between Sunday night through Tuesday. With snow levels increasing above 5000 feet, there is an increased risk of areal flooding in small creeks, streams and flood prone areas. The Weather Prediction Center has also issued a Moderate Risk for excessive rainfall for the watch area Monday into Tuesday. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Curry County Coast; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County
